shortdef: to divide or organize into districts

dt: {bc}a territorial division of a state from which a member of the U.S. House of Representatives is elected

shortdef: a territorial division of a state from which a member of the U.S. House of Representatives is elected

dt: {bc}an electoral district or constituency having two or more representatives in a legislative body rather than one

dt.t: In a single-member district that's split 60-40 along party lines, the 40 percent minority gets no representative. … But in a {wi}multi-member{/wi} district, the 40 percent gets a share of the seats.

shortdef: an electoral district or constituency having two or more representatives in a legislative body rather than one

dt: {bc}a unit for administration of a public-school system often comprising several towns within a state

shortdef: a unit for administration of a public-school system often comprising several towns within a state

dt: {bc}a territorial division from which a senator is elected {dx}compare {dxt|congressional district||}{/dx}

shortdef: a territorial division from which a senator is elected

dt: {bc}an electoral district or constituency having a single representative in a legislative body rather than two or more

dt.t: In its first case declaring multimember districts unconstitutional in 1973, the Supreme Court declared that the Texas system of electing state representatives from county multimember districts, rather than {wi}single-member districts{/wi}, discriminated against African-Americans and Latinos.

shortdef: an electoral district or constituency having a single representative in a legislative body rather than two or more

dt.t: In 1996, county commissioners created a public library district with two {wi}subdistricts{/wi}—Eastern and Western—and set a property tax rate that voters in each district had to adopt.
Benefited water districts and {wi}subdistricts{/wi}, organized for the purpose of supplying water for particular areas …

dt: {bc}a subdivision of an administrative county especially in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland

shortdef: a subdivision of an administrative county especially in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland
